key_reasons: The patient has a confirmed diagnosis of polyarthrite rhumatoïde, which is equivalent to rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This was stated in multiple clinical notes by Agent 2.
RF and anti-CCP are both negative, matching the criteria for RA−. However, due to conflicting evidence from other sources that may not be fully clear or consistent.
The patient has been on DMARD therapy with abatacept since 2021, which is a strong indicator of having rheumatoid arthritis.
red_flags: There are multiple mentions of polyarthrite rhumatoïde in the notes by different agents. However, one diagnosis (rheumatoid arthritis) has been explicitly negated.
The conflicting evidence from other sources makes it difficult to fully conclude that this is a case of RA+.
questions_for_human: Can you clarify if there are any alternative diagnoses for the polyarthrite rhumatoïde? Are there any more recent clinical notes that might provide clearer information?
Are all serology tests clear and consistent in their results (RF, anti-CCP)?
